title: State-Sponsored Terrorism, Crimes - Collection 21 (Drone Warfare
description:
State-Sponsored Terrorism, Crimes, and Lies - Collection 21 (Drone Warfare):

We have 35 titles here:

-  Abdul-Rehman - Impact of Drone Attack in Pakistan and the War on Terror, Malmo Univ. (Oct., 2013)

-  Amnesty Int. - USA, Targeted Killing Policies Violate the Right to Life (2012)

-  Amnesty Int. - Will I Be Next; US Drone Strikes in Pakistan (2013)

-  Anderson - Targeted Killing and Drone Warfare; How to Come to Debate Whether There Is a Legal Geography of War, Hoover Institution, Stanford Univ. (2011)

-  Bashir & Crews - Under the Drones; Modern Lives in the Afghanistan-Pakistan Borderlands (2012)

-  Benjamin - Drone Warfare; Killing by Remote Control (2012)

-  Benjamin - War on Demand; the Global Rise of Drones, Rosa Luxemburg Stiftung (June, 2013)

-  Bergen & Rothenberg (Eds.) - Drone Wars; Transforming Conflict, Law, and Policy (2015)

-  Boyle - The Costs and Consequences of Drone Warfare, Int. Affairs (2013)

-  Chomsky & Vltchek - On Western Terrorism from Hiroshima to Drone Warfare (2013)

-  Counting Drone Strike Deaths, Columbia Law School (Oct., 2012)

-  Drone Warfare; Are Strikes by Unmanned Aircraft Ethical, CQ Researcher, Aug. 6, 2010

-  Drone Wars; the Constitutional and Counterterrorism Implications of Targeted Killing, Statement on Behalf of Amnesty Int. USA (April, 2013)

-  Drones; the Physical and Psychological Implications of a Global Theatre of War, Medact (2012)

-  Dworkin - Drones and Targeted Killing; Defining a European Position, European Council on Foreign Relations (July, 2013)

-  Evangelista & Shue (Eds.) - The American Way of Bombing; Changing Ethical and Legal Norms, from B-17s to Drones (2014)

-  Finkelstein et al (Eds.) - Targeted Killings; Law and Morality in an Asymmetrical World (2012)

-  Forge - Designed to Kill; the Case Against Weapons Research (2013)

-  HRW - A Wedding That Became a Funeral; US Drone Attack on Marriage Procession in Yemen (2014)

-  HRW - Losing Humanity; the Case Against Killer Robots (2012)

-  HRW - Shaking the Foundations; the Human Rights Implications of Killer Robots (2014)

-  Human Rights Implications of the Usage of Drones and Unmanned Robots in warfare, Policy Dept., European Parliament (2013)

-  Kaag & Kreps - Drone Warfare (2014)

-  Living Under Drones; Death, Injury, and Trauma to Civilians from US Drone Practice in Pakistan, Stanford-NYU Report, Sept. 2012

-  Martin & Sasser - Predator; the Remote-Control Air War Over Iraq and Afghanistan; a Pilot's Story (2010)

-  Olson & Rashid - Modern Drone Warfare; an Ethical Analysis, American Society for Engineering Education (2013)

-  Recommendations and Report of the Task Force on US Drone Policy, Stimson (June, 2014)

-  Rogers & Hill - Unmanned; Drone Warfare and Global Security (2014)

-  Shaw - Predator Empire; the Geopolitics of US Drone Warfare, Geopolitics (June, 2013)

-  Shaw - The Spatial Politics of Drone Warfare; PhD Dissertation, Univ. of Arizona (2011)

-  Shaw & Akhter - The Dronification of State Violence, Critical Asian Studies (2014)

-  Sterio - The U.S. Use of Drones in the War on Terror; the Illegality of Targeted Killings Under International Law, CWR Journal of Int. Law, (Fall, 2012)

-  Turse & Engelhardt - Terminator Planet; the First History of Drone Warfare, 2001-2050 (2012)

-  Williams - Predators; the CIA's Drone War on al Qaeda (2013)

-  Zenko - Reforming US Drone Strike Policies, Council on Foreign Relations, Report No. 65, Jan. (2013)
